name: Arbosana
description: Fruity, nutty tones, with tasting notes of green tomato and almond. Creamy, delicate aftertaste. Drizzle over greens, saut√© vegetables, or grill fish. (California)

name: Arbequina
description: Smooth and elegant, with notes of green apple and almond. Great for salads, making pesto, or adding light flavor to roasted vegetables. (Chile)

name: Coratina Gran Cru
description: Highly complex, made from hand-picked olives. Displays herbaceous qualities and notes of green apple. Unique, floral finish. Clean, crisp and pungent. (Italy)

name: Frantoio/Leccino
description: Displays a creamy, malty center & notes of green grass and wildflowers. Light yet fruity olive aroma. Turns even ordinary greens into gourmet delights. (Italy)

name: Hojiblanca
description: Robust olive flavor and aroma, with notes of ripe banana and apple. Pair with any balsamic vinegar, but especially Traditional, Juniper Berry or Pomegranate. (Spain)

name: Koroneiki
description: Exquisite and flavorful aroma. Fresh fruit-of-the-olive taste, with hints of artichoke and fresh grass.  Peppery aftertaste. Enjoy on salads, roasted meats, hearty vegetables. (Greece)

name: Mission
description: Developed by early California missionaries, this olive produces a bold oil, very high in antioxidant polyphenols, and favored by the health-conscious. Flavors are layered and complex, with a fleeting bitter center. (California)

name: Picual
description: Smooth, fruity olive oil for use with and on everything. Complex yet well-balanced, with a lovely aroma and lightly grassy aftertaste. (Australia)
